<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The AddrSig section uses a series of relocations to refer to the symbols that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// should be considered address-significant. The only interesting content of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// these relocations is their symbol; the type, length etc will be ignored by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the linker. The reason we are not referring to the symbol indices directly is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that those indices will be invalidated by tools that update the symbol table.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Symbol relocations OTOH will have their indices updated by e.g. llvm-strip.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mcmachostreamer-cpp-/mcmachostreamer/#a5b9193e77b26973b0c65a96716330b87"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mcmachostreamer-cpp-/mcmachostreamer/#a5b9193e77b26973b0c65a96716330b87">MCMachOStreamer::createAddrSigSection</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Frag = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;MCDataFragment&gt;</a>(AddrSigSection-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsection/#ac28ea8ba1e28d8b3a3ca7234e1bc1083">curFragList</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mcsection/fraglist/#a3642f400a4586489d672ba4501c486b6">Head</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We will generate a series of pointer-sized symbol relocations at offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 0x0. Set the section size to be large enough to contain a single pointer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (instead of emitting a zero-sized section) so these relocations are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
